attributes.author: Vatinas
attributes.description:
Allows the changing of the grenade icon in your teammates' panels in your HUD depending on what blitz they are using. You can change the icon of any specific blitz to a selection of icons in the mod options menu, but the default is the following:

[list]
[*]Blitzes that use grenade pickups (e.g. Vet's Frag grenades / Zealot's Stun grenades): Default grenade icon (as it is without this mod).
[*]Blitzes that don't use grenade pickups, but have charges (e.g. Ogryn Rocks / Psyker's Assail): Lightning bolt icon
[*]Blitzes that neither use grenade pickups, nor have any charges (Psyker's Brain burst & Smite): No icon
[/list]
Also allows you to hide the ammo icon in your teammates' panels if their weapon doesn't use ammo (Psyker staves), if the relevant option is toggled on (on by default).
attributes.name: AlternateGrenadeIcons-322-1-0-1717874669
attributes.shortDescription:
Change the grenade icon for your teammates in your HUD to reflect what blitz they are using - by default, the base grenade icon for blitzes that use grenade pickups, a lightning bolt for blitzes that don't, but have charges, and no icon for blitzes that don't have charges.

Hide the ammo icon for Psyker staves.

attributes.author: ItsAlxl
attributes.description:
Displays your current contract progress for each character in the character selection menu.

Most of this mod's original functionality has been officially implemented by Fatshark, so that obsolete functionality has been removed from the mod. Here is the original description for historical purposes:
[spoiler]Normally, Sire Melk doesn't actually start to track your contract progress until you talk to him first every week. He similarly holds the weekly completion bonus hostage until you talk to him.

With BetterMelk, you don't have to talk to him for either of these: you will automatically accept new contracts and automatically collect the weekly completion bonus. You can also enable messages to notify you when you have new* contracts (disabled by default) or when you've finished all your contracts (enabled by default).

Additionally, your current weekly contract progress for each character is displayed in the character select screen.

* Note that for the purposes of this notification, the mod assumes your contracts are new if you just loaded into the hub and all your contracts have zero progress on them. So if you, for example, repeatedly quit to character select and re-enter the hub, you'll be told you have new contracts even though you don't really.[/spoiler]
If you want to make Sire Melk more enjoyable to talk to, consider downloading my other mod [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kdarktide/mods/59]Friendly Vendors[/url].

[url=https://ko-fi.com/itsalxl][img]https://ko-fi.com/img/githubbutton_sm.svg[/img][/url]

Simplified Chinese localization by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/127776653]deluxghost[/url]
Russian localization by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/2593497]xsSplater[/url]﻿

Source: [url=https://github.com/ItsAlxl/DarktideMods/tree/main/BetterMelk]GitHub[/url]
attributes.name: BetterMelk-71-1-8-1692114838
attributes.shortDescription: Displays your current contract progress in character select.

attributes.author: Wobin
attributes.description:
It's been an absolute mess since the last patch whereby we can surrender up weapons to obtain access to one of the blessings on said weapon. And so we were all scrabbling in our inventories to figure out which items could fill in the slots of our Blessing Bingo Booklet.

This mod will add a little indicator on (or near) any blessing that you have not already surrendered on this account. There's the option for an amber indicator to show if you've redeemed this blessing at a higher rank.

It currently only shows on your equipped items, your inventory and the assorted shop inventories.

It adds in a hotkey to shuffle between an unfiltered/show all unearnt blessings/show max level unearnt blessings filter on Hadron's inventory page.
attributes.name: Blessings of the Omnissiah-46-2-2-1686582897
attributes.shortDescription: Adds an indicator to the shop and inventory items to signal if they hold blessings that are available to surrender to the Omnissiah. This will also indicate if you have a higher ranked blessing already earned. You also will be able to filter by items with unearnt blessings in Hadron's inventory screen

attributes.author: Aussiemon-Grimalackt-ChibaCityBlues
attributes.description:
This mod allows you to spawn any creatures you wish in games that you control. Currently, this is only the Prologue and the Meat Grinder training area.

The full features are:
[list]
[*]Spawn any creature, sorted by lists in Mod Options
[*]Trials / spawn wave system written by Grimalackt

[*]Save up to 3 creatures with the /save_unit <number> command and spawn them through separate hotkeys
[*]Display the names of your saved creatures with the /selected_units command
[*]Despawn all creatures
[*]Hotkeys to heal, restore toughness, reset ability cooldown, and assist the player in the Meat Grinder
[*]Disable vanilla spawns in the Meat Grinder
[*]Disable the sound muffler in the Meat Grinder
[*]Disable player invisibility in the Meat Grinder (toggle keybind)
[*]Disable player invulnerability in the Meat Grinder (toggle keybind)
[/list]
All hotkeys are unassigned by default, so open Mod Options and set them to start using the mod.

[b]Spawning creatures outside of their normal levels and some actions (e.g. dying in the Meat Grinder) with the mod can cause crashes. At worst you'll have to restart the game, but use at your own risk.[/b]
attributes.name: Creature Spawner-25-24-09-29-1727595589
attributes.shortDescription: Allows spawning/despawning creatures in self-hosted lobbies. Also contains enhancements for the Meat Grinder.

attributes.author: Redbeardt
attributes.description:
[b][size=4]DarkCache
[/size]
[/b]This mod implements prefetching and caching of both the Mourningstar itself, and many of the menus accessible within it such as those of the Armoury, Melk, and the Premium Store. You should find that all the menus load very quickly with this mod. The caching of the Mourningstar level itself is done during the first load, so while your initial load into the Mourningstar won't be any faster, all your subsequent ones should be. [b][UPDATE] [/b]Version 1.3 includes preloading of the Mourningstar, starting as soon as Darktide starts, and should shave some time off loading into the game. Note that this requires that some data be generated [i]during[/i] loading the Mourningstar, so your first load after enabling preloading will not be any faster; subsequent ones will.

[b]WARNING: [/b]The Mourningstar caching will increase memory usage, in particular when you are in a mission, as the assets for the Mourningstar and the mission will be in memory. If this causes you any issues and you want to use the other features of the mod, you can disable the Mourningstar caching in the mod options. Please note though that due to how it works, (currently) you have to restart the game for it to release the Mourningstar assets entirely.

[b]Features
[/b][list]
[*]Prefetching and caching for both of the Armoury's stores.
[*]Prefetching and caching for Melk's Requisitorium including the Contracts menu.
[*]Prefetching and caching for the Commissary's cosmetics stores.

[*]Prefetching and caching of the Mission Board. This is actually off by default because, honestly, it didn't do much for me personally.
[*]Prefetching and caching of the Premium Store. No more watching Hallowette wave her arms around for ten seconds.
[*]Caching of the Mourningstar level itself. For me this reduced my loading time from about 25 seconds to about 10 seconds.
[*]Much faster Psykhanium loading. For me this was about 3 seconds.
[*]Mod options for toggling cache items, just in-case you have issues with one of them.
[*]Preloading of the Mourningstar, saving time loading in. For me the saving is about ten seconds.
[/list]
[b]Installation

[/b]This mod uses the[b] Darktide Mod Loader[/b] and [b]Darktide Mod Framework[/b] (you'll be prompted to install them when you go to download this mod), which
are available on this site. Once you have those in place, you can install this mod by extracting the [font=Courier New]DarkCache [/font]folder into your mods folder, then adding [font=Courier New]DarkCache[/font] to your [font=Courier New]mod_load_order.txt[/font].

[b]Usage

[/b]The mod comes with settings for each category of caching so that you can toggle things if something isn't working right. You can access them via the Mod Options menu by hitting Escape, or simply by hitting F4. Mourningstar caching and preloading is disabled by default so that players whose systems have less memory do not immediately run into problems when they add the mod. For everyone else, I recommend enabling both Mourningstar caching and preloading.

If you like my work, please consider supporting me via my [url=https://www.buymeacoffee.com/redbeardt]Buy Me A Coffee[/url].
attributes.name: DarkCache-114-1-4-1688035784
attributes.shortDescription: Makes the Armoury and Melk load faster, and makes the Premium Store load MUCH faster. Also makes the Mourningstar itself load faster, and makes the Psykhanium load MUCH faster.

attributes.author: Darktide Modders
attributes.description:
The Darktide Mod Framework is both a modding resource and tool for players to manage their installed mods ingame. The framework is designed to be both independent and lightweight; making no changes to gameplay on its own.

Mods created for the project may utilize:

* Mod options
* Shared function hooks
* Chat commands
* Keybinds
* Rewritten, lightweight mod functions
* An on-event call system

The Darktide Mod Framework originally started in Warhammer End Times: Vermintide as an unofficial modding platform. In the time since, DMF has been rewritten and redesigned with contributions from many unique members of the community; culminating in this unified project.

For more information, check out [b][url=http://dmf-docs.darkti.de]the framework's wiki pages[/url][/b] and the [url=https://dmf-docs.darkti.de/index#/installing-mods]installation guide[/url].

[b]This mod requires the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kdarktide/mods/19/?tab=description]Darktide Mod Loader[/url], but does not need to be added to your mod_load_order.txt file.[/b]
attributes.name: Darktide Mod Framework-8-24-07-12-1720764449.1
attributes.shortDescription: An open-source, community-run framework of modules that provides enhanced modding capabilities and support.

attributes.description:
Ammo Crates in Darktide have four charges, each will refill your ammo to full. To prevent accidentally depriving your team mates of ammo by double dipping right at the end, this will change the colour of the icon to indicate how many charges are left.

Teal - 4
Yellow - 3
Orange -2
Red - 1

This will also offer an option to show the heal range in a medkit. This will be an outer circle to indicate range, If a squad mate has Field Improvisation, the colour of the inner circle will be different to show the difference in effect. 

Thank you raindish for figuring out the radial indicator for the medkits

attributes.author: ItsAlxl
attributes.description:
In vanilla Darktide, you are not allowed to refund a talent if you have subsequent nodes that depend on it. With this mod, refunding a talent will also refund all of the talents that depend on it, making it easier to switch around your talents in the middle of the talent tree. Additionally, you can swap exclusive talents by double-clicking and the mod will try to preserve as much as possible below those talents. If you have 0 talent points remaining, the mod will allow you to swap siblings as long as the swap would result in a valid tree. See images for examples of each action.

Each of those two actions can be configured to either be disabled, activate on single-click, or activate on double-click.

[b]Make sure that your new connections will still be valid before you swap exclusive talents! [/b]If the rest of your tree is not connected to the talent that you're swapping to, it'll reset everything below that point. So please save yourself some headache and make sure that your connections will work before swapping exclusive talents.

Please note that your game may briefly hitch when swapping exclusive talents, particularly near the top of the tree. That's because the mod is removing all talents below it, then trying to re-equip them all.

Simplified Chinese localization by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/127776653]deluxghost[/url]
Russian localization by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/2593497]xsSplater[/url]﻿

[url=https://ko-fi.com/itsalxl][img]https://ko-fi.com/img/githubbutton_sm.svg[/img][/url]

Source: [url=https://github.com/ItsAlxl/darktide-mods/tree/main/TalentRefundBelow]GitHub[/url]
attributes.name: TalentRefundBelow-216-1-5-1698496483
attributes.shortDescription: Remove a talent and all subsequent talents in one right-click, and swap talents without having to redo what's below them with a double-click

attributes.author: Zombine
attributes.description:
After you reach level 30, you won't level up anymore but you'll still earn exp.

This mod reads those recorded exp, and converts them into actual level you can reach.

The calculation is simple; It divides exp you've earned after level 30 by exp required to level up from 29 to 30 (requires 11,100 XP) .

[b]Features:[/b]
[list]
[*]Display the estimated level in the character select screen, team hud, nameplates, lobby, results screen, and social menu.
[*]Two different display style + prestige-like level (shows how many times you passed from level 1 to 30) .
[*]The display style for each element/screen is individually customizable.
[*]A notification will appear when you level up.
[/list]
[b]Notes:
[/b][list]
[*]After Patch #12, the XP needed to level up from 29 to 30 has been changed, so that affects the calculation of the true level. It now requires 11,100 XP (previously 7,330 XP) .
[*]Compatible with the latest version of [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kdarktide/mods/127]Who Are You[/url] mod.﻿
[/list]
[url=https://ko-fi.com/zombine][img]https://ko-fi.com/img/githubbutton_sm.svg[/img][/url]
attributes.name: True Level-156-1-5-0-1713679456

attributes.author: Redbeardt
attributes.description:
[b]Barter with Hadron

[/b]This is a pretty basic one but I think something a lot of people might want.

You know how you can "barter" aka. "sell" items in your inventory by holding X? This lets you do that at Hadron's.

That's it.

[b]Installation

[/b]Extract the archive so that the [font=Courier New]barter_with_hadron[/font] folder is in your mods folder, then add [font=Courier New]barter_with_hadron[/font] to your [font=Courier New]mod_load_order.txt[/font].

[b]Usage

[/b]Go to Hadron's. Select an item you want to sell. Hold X. You will hear the familiar sound, but importantly, there won't be an animation. This is because I am tired and frustrated and maybe later. After 3/4 of a second you will hear the finishing sound, the item will vanish from the list, and you'll get some ordo dockets as indicated by the notification.

As usual if you like my work plz consider throwing some dollarydoos at me via my [url=https://www.buymeacoffee.com/dashboard]Buy Me A Coffee[/url].

If there are any issues or you just wanna say thanks, feel free to drop a comment in this mod's forum.

Happy Bartering!
attributes.name: barter_with_hadron1-54-1-1a-1687239098
attributes.shortDescription: Y'know how in your inventory you can hold x to sell items? This lets you do that while crafting at Hadron's.

fileInfo.name: BetterMelk

modInfo.author: ItsAlxl
modInfo.description:
Normally, Sire Melk doesn't actually start to track your contract progress until you talk to him first every week. He similarly holds the weekly completion bonus hostage until you talk to him.

With BetterMelk, you don't have to talk to him for either of these: you will automatically accept new contracts and automatically collect the weekly completion bonus. You can also enable messages to notify you when you have new* contracts (disabled by default) or when you've finished all your contracts (enabled by default).

Additionally, your current weekly contract progress for each character is displayed in the character select screen.

If you want to see your contract progress mid-mission, get [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kdarktide/mods/145]Contracts Overlay[/url] by Zombine. If you want to make Sire Melk more enjoyable to talk to, consider downloading my other mod [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kdarktide/mods/59]Friendly Vendors[/url].

* Note that for the purposes of this notification, the mod assumes your contracts are new if you just loaded into the hub and all your contracts have zero progress on them. So if you, for example, repeatedly quit to character select and re-enter the hub, you'll be told you have new contracts even though you don't really.

[url=https://ko-fi.com/itsalxl][img]https://ko-fi.com/img/githubbutton_sm.svg[/img][/url]

Simplified Chinese localization by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/127776653]deluxghost[/url]
Russian localization by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/2593497]xsSplater[/url]﻿

Source: [url=https://github.com/ItsAlxl/DarktideMods/tree/main/BetterMelk]GitHub[/url]
modInfo.name: Better Melk
modInfo.summary: Automatically accept new contracts and collect the weekly completion bonus, and display your current contract progress in character select.

fileInfo.name: Ration Pack

modInfo.author: Wobin
modInfo.description:
Ammo Crates in Darktide have four charges, each will refill your ammo to full. To prevent accidentally depriving your team mates of ammo by double dipping right at the end, this will change the colour of the icon to indicate how many charges are left.

Teal - 4
Yellow - 3
Orange -2
Red - 1

Additionally if a Veteran squad mate (or yourself) is running the Field Improvisation talent, the ring will change colour to indicate the improved ammo crate state

This will also offer an option to show the heal range in a medkit. This will be an outer circle to indicate range, If a squad mate has Field Improvisation, the colour of the inner circle will be different to show the difference in effect. 

Thank you raindish for figuring out the radial indicator for the medkits
modInfo.name: Ration Pack
modInfo.summary: Adds colour to the icon for the Ammo Crate to indicate how many charges are remaining

fileInfo.name: Buy Until Rating

modInfo.author: Zombine
modInfo.description:
[size=5][center]v2.0 is available now![/center]
[/size]The mod has been overhauled in v2.0. It is more stable and smoother than previous versions. And some issues are fixed, such as notification dots remaining on the loadout screen.

[b]Main features:[/b]
[list]
[*]Automatically purchase selected weapon at Brunt's Armoury until you receive one that has the rating you desired or above.
[*]Discard purchased items automatically if they aren't over the rating you set (separated from desired rating) .
[*]Stop buying if a quantity limit is set and the number of purchase exceeds that.
[/list]
This mod is good for who has a lot of dockets and wants good stats weapons quickly.


[center][url=https://ko-fi.com/zombine][img]https://ko-fi.com/img/githubbutton_sm.svg[/img][/url][/center]
modInfo.name: Buy Until Rating
modInfo.summary: Automatically continue to buy selected weapon at Brunt's Armoury until you receive one with good stats, and items of lower stats will be sold automatically.

modInfo.author: Zombine
modInfo.description:
After you reach level 30, you won't level up anymore but you'll still earn exp.

This mod reads those recorded exp, and converts them into actual level you can reach.

The calculation is simple; It divides exp you've earned after level 30 by exp required to level up from 29 to 30 (requires 11,100 XP) .

[b]Features:[/b]
[list]
[*]Display the estimated level in the character select screen, team hud, nameplates, lobby, results screen, and social menu.
[*]Two different display style + prestige-like level (shows how many times you passed from level 1 to 30) .
[*]The display style for each element/screen is individually customizable.
[*]A notification will appear when you level up.
[/list]
[b]Notes:
[/b][list]
[*]After Patch #12, the XP needed to level up from 29 to 30 has been changed, so that affects the calculation of the true level. It now requires 11,100 XP (previously 7,330 XP) .
[*]Compatible with the latest version of [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kdarktide/mods/127]Who Are You[/url] mod.﻿
[/list]
[url=https://ko-fi.com/zombine][img]https://ko-fi.com/img/githubbutton_sm.svg[/img][/url]
modInfo.name: True Level
modInfo.summary: Reads recorded exp earned after you hit the max level, and displays the actual level you can reach.

modInfo.author: Vatinas
modInfo.description:
Allows the changing of the grenade icon in your teammates' panels in your HUD depending on what blitz they are using. You can change the icon of any specific blitz to a selection of icons in the mod options menu, but the default is the following:

[list]
[*]Blitzes that use grenade pickups (e.g. Vet's Frag grenades / Zealot's Stun grenades): Default grenade icon (as it is without this mod).
[*]Blitzes that don't use grenade pickups, but have charges (e.g. Ogryn Rocks / Psyker's Assail): Lightning bolt icon
[*]Blitzes that neither use grenade pickups, nor have any charges (Psyker's Brain burst & Smite): No icon
[/list]
Also allows you to hide the ammo icon in your teammates' panels if their weapon doesn't use ammo (Psyker staves), if the relevant option is toggled on (on by default).
modInfo.name: Alternate Grenade Icons
modInfo.summary:
Change the grenade icon for your teammates in your HUD to reflect what blitz they are using - by default, the base grenade icon for blitzes that use grenade pickups, a lightning bolt for blitzes that don't, but have charges, and no icon for blitzes that don't have charges.

Hide the ammo icon for Psyker staves.

[b]Barter with Hadron

[/b]This is a pretty basic one but I think something a lot of people might want.

You know how you can "barter" aka. "sell" items in your inventory by holding X? This lets you do that at Hadron's.

That's it.

[b]Installation

[/b]Extract the archive so that the [font=Courier New]barter_with_hadron[/font] folder is in your mods folder, then add [font=Courier New]barter_with_hadron[/font] to your [font=Courier New]mod_load_order.txt[/font].

[b]Usage

[/b]Go to Hadron's. Select an item you want to sell. Hold X. You will hear the familiar sound, but importantly, there won't be an animation. This is because I am tired and frustrated and maybe later. After 3/4 of a second you will hear the finishing sound, the item will vanish from the list, and you'll get some ordo dockets as indicated by the notification.

As usual if you like my work plz consider throwing some dollarydoos at me via my [url=https://www.buymeacoffee.com/dashboard]Buy Me A Coffee[/url].

If there are any issues or you just wanna say thanks, feel free to drop a comment in this mod's forum.

Happy Bartering!
modInfo.name: Barter with Hadron
modInfo.summary: Y'know how in your inventory you can hold x to sell items? This lets you do that while crafting at Hadron's.

modInfo.author: Wobin
modInfo.description:
Ammo Crates in Darktide have four charges, each will refill your ammo to full. To prevent accidentally depriving your team mates of ammo by double dipping right at the end, this will change the colour of the icon to indicate how many charges are left.

Teal - 4
Yellow - 3
Orange -2
Red - 1

Additionally if a Veteran squad mate (or yourself) is running the Field Improvisation talent, the ring will change colour to indicate the improved ammo crate state

This will also offer an option to show the heal range in a medkit. This will be an outer circle to indicate range, If a squad mate has Field Improvisation, the colour of the inner circle will be different to show the difference in effect.

Thank you raindish for figuring out the radial indicator for the medkits

fileInfo.name: BetterMelk

modInfo.author: ItsAlxl
modInfo.description:
Displays your current contract progress for each character in the character selection menu.

Most of this mod's original functionality has been officially implemented by Fatshark, so that obsolete functionality has been removed from the mod. Here is the original description for historical purposes:
[spoiler]Normally, Sire Melk doesn't actually start to track your contract progress until you talk to him first every week. He similarly holds the weekly completion bonus hostage until you talk to him.

With BetterMelk, you don't have to talk to him for either of these: you will automatically accept new contracts and automatically collect the weekly completion bonus. You can also enable messages to notify you when you have new* contracts (disabled by default) or when you've finished all your contracts (enabled by default).

Additionally, your current weekly contract progress for each character is displayed in the character select screen.

* Note that for the purposes of this notification, the mod assumes your contracts are new if you just loaded into the hub and all your contracts have zero progress on them. So if you, for example, repeatedly quit to character select and re-enter the hub, you'll be told you have new contracts even though you don't really.[/spoiler]
If you want to make Sire Melk more enjoyable to talk to, consider downloading my other mod [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kdarktide/mods/59]Friendly Vendors[/url].

[url=https://ko-fi.com/itsalxl][img]https://ko-fi.com/img/githubbutton_sm.svg[/img][/url]

Simplified Chinese localization by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/127776653]deluxghost[/url]
Russian localization by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/2593497]xsSplater[/url]﻿

Source: [url=https://github.com/ItsAlxl/DarktideMods/tree/main/BetterMelk]GitHub[/url]

modInfo.summary: Displays your current contract progress in character select.

fileInfo.name: Darktide Mod Framework

modInfo.author: Darktide Modders
modInfo.description:
The Darktide Mod Framework is both a modding resource and tool for players to manage their installed mods ingame. The framework is designed to be both independent and lightweight; making no changes to gameplay on its own.

Mods created for the project may utilize:

* Mod options
* Shared function hooks
* Chat commands
* Keybinds
* Rewritten, lightweight mod functions
* An on-event call system

The Darktide Mod Framework originally started in Warhammer End Times: Vermintide as an unofficial modding platform. In the time since, DMF has been rewritten and redesigned with contributions from many unique members of the community; culminating in this unified project.

For more information, check out [b][url=http://dmf-docs.darkti.de]the framework's wiki pages[/url][/b] and the [url=https://dmf-docs.darkti.de/index#/installing-mods]installation guide[/url].

[b]This mod requires the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kdarktide/mods/19/?tab=description]Darktide Mod Loader[/url], but does not need to be added to your mod_load_order.txt file.[/b]
modInfo.name: Darktide Mod Framework
modInfo.summary: An open-source, community-run framework of modules that provides enhanced modding capabilities and support.

fileInfo.changelog_html: Updated Simplified Chinese localization (deluxghost)
fileInfo.name: TalentRefundBelow

modInfo.author: ItsAlxl
modInfo.description:
In vanilla Darktide, you are not allowed to refund a talent if you have subsequent nodes that depend on it. With this mod, refunding a talent will also refund all of the talents that depend on it, making it easier to switch around your talents in the middle of the talent tree. Additionally, you can swap exclusive talents by double-clicking and the mod will try to preserve as much as possible below those talents. If you have 0 talent points remaining, the mod will allow you to swap siblings as long as the swap would result in a valid tree. See images for examples of each action.

Each of those two actions can be configured to either be disabled, activate on single-click, or activate on double-click.

[b]Make sure that your new connections will still be valid before you swap exclusive talents! [/b]If the rest of your tree is not connected to the talent that you're swapping to, it'll reset everything below that point. So please save yourself some headache and make sure that your connections will work before swapping exclusive talents.

Please note that your game may briefly hitch when swapping exclusive talents, particularly near the top of the tree. That's because the mod is removing all talents below it, then trying to re-equip them all.

Simplified Chinese localization by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/127776653]deluxghost[/url]
Russian localization by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/2593497]xsSplater[/url]﻿

[url=https://ko-fi.com/itsalxl][img]https://ko-fi.com/img/githubbutton_sm.svg[/img][/url]

Source: [url=https://github.com/ItsAlxl/darktide-mods/tree/main/TalentRefundBelow]GitHub[/url]
modInfo.name: Talent Tree UX Improvements
modInfo.summary: Remove a talent and all subsequent talents in one right-click, and swap talents without having to redo what's below them with a double-click

fileInfo.name: Blessings of the Omnissiah

modInfo.author: Wobin
modInfo.description:
It's been an absolute mess since the last patch whereby we can surrender up weapons to obtain access to one of the blessings on said weapon. And so we were all scrabbling in our inventories to figure out which items could fill in the slots of our Blessing Bingo Booklet.

This mod will add a little indicator on (or near) any blessing that you have not already surrendered on this account. There's the option for an amber indicator to show if you've redeemed this blessing at a higher rank.

It currently only shows on your equipped items, your inventory and the assorted shop inventories.

It adds in a hotkey to shuffle between an unfiltered/show all unearnt blessings/show max level unearnt blessings filter on Hadron's inventory page.
modInfo.name: Blessings of the Omnissiah
modInfo.summary: Adds an indicator to the shop and inventory items to signal if they hold blessings that are available to surrender to the Omnissiah. This will also indicate if you have a higher ranked blessing already earned. You also will be able to filter by items with unearnt blessings in Hadron's inventory screen

Added option to toggle suppressing the "Cache Regeneration required" notification that appears when game version has changed (default is off).
Added Icon Caching. Prevents generated item icons from being unloaded (and reloaded) by scrolling or exiting out of item list views.

fileInfo.name: DarkCache

modInfo.author: Redbeardt
modInfo.description:
[b][size=4]DarkCache
[/size]
[/b]This mod implements prefetching and caching of both the Mourningstar itself, and many of the menus accessible within it such as those of the Armoury, Melk, and the Premium Store. You should find that all the menus load very quickly with this mod. The caching of the Mourningstar level itself is done during the first load, so while your initial load into the Mourningstar won't be any faster, all your subsequent ones should be. [b][UPDATE] [/b]Version 1.3 includes preloading of the Mourningstar, starting as soon as Darktide starts, and should shave some time off loading into the game. Note that this requires that some data be generated [i]during[/i] loading the Mourningstar, so your first load after enabling preloading will not be any faster; subsequent ones will.

[b]WARNING: [/b]The Mourningstar caching will increase memory usage, in particular when you are in a mission, as the assets for the Mourningstar and the mission will be in memory. If this causes you any issues and you want to use the other features of the mod, you can disable the Mourningstar caching in the mod options. Please note though that due to how it works, (currently) you have to restart the game for it to release the Mourningstar assets entirely.

[b]Features
[/b][list]
[*]Prefetching and caching for both of the Armoury's stores.
[*]Prefetching and caching for Melk's Requisitorium including the Contracts menu.
[*]Prefetching and caching for the Commissary's cosmetics stores.

[*]Prefetching and caching of the Mission Board. This is actually off by default because, honestly, it didn't do much for me personally.
[*]Prefetching and caching of the Premium Store. No more watching Hallowette wave her arms around for ten seconds.
[*]Caching of the Mourningstar level itself. For me this reduced my loading time from about 25 seconds to about 10 seconds.
[*]Much faster Psykhanium loading. For me this was about 3 seconds.
[*]Mod options for toggling cache items, just in-case you have issues with one of them.
[*]Preloading of the Mourningstar, saving time loading in. For me the saving is about ten seconds.
[/list]
[b]Installation

[/b]This mod uses the[b] Darktide Mod Loader[/b] and [b]Darktide Mod Framework[/b] (you'll be prompted to install them when you go to download this mod), which
are available on this site. Once you have those in place, you can install this mod by extracting the [font=Courier New]DarkCache [/font]folder into your mods folder, then adding [font=Courier New]DarkCache[/font] to your [font=Courier New]mod_load_order.txt[/font].

[b]Usage

[/b]The mod comes with settings for each category of caching so that you can toggle things if something isn't working right. You can access them via the Mod Options menu by hitting Escape, or simply by hitting F4. Mourningstar caching and preloading is disabled by default so that players whose systems have less memory do not immediately run into problems when they add the mod. For everyone else, I recommend enabling both Mourningstar caching and preloading.

If you like my work, please consider supporting me via my [url=https://www.buymeacoffee.com/redbeardt]Buy Me A Coffee[/url].
modInfo.name: DarkCache
modInfo.summary: Makes the Armoury and Melk load faster, and makes the Premium Store load MUCH faster. Also makes the Mourningstar itself load faster, and makes the Psykhanium load MUCH faster.

modInfo.author: Aussiemon-Grimalackt-ChibaCityBlues
modInfo.description:
This mod allows you to spawn any creatures you wish in games that you control. Currently, this is only the Prologue and the Meat Grinder training area.

The full features are:
[list]
[*]Spawn any creature, sorted by lists in Mod Options
[*]Trials / spawn wave system written by Grimalackt

[*]Save up to 3 creatures with the /save_unit <number> command and spawn them through separate hotkeys
[*]Display the names of your saved creatures with the /selected_units command
[*]Despawn all creatures
[*]Hotkeys to heal, restore toughness, reset ability cooldown, and assist the player in the Meat Grinder
[*]Disable vanilla spawns in the Meat Grinder
[*]Disable the sound muffler in the Meat Grinder
[*]Disable player invisibility in the Meat Grinder (toggle keybind)
[*]Disable player invulnerability in the Meat Grinder (toggle keybind)
[/list]
All hotkeys are unassigned by default, so open Mod Options and set them to start using the mod.

[b]Spawning creatures outside of their normal levels and some actions (e.g. dying in the Meat Grinder) with the mod can cause crashes. At worst you'll have to restart the game, but use at your own risk.[/b]

[u][u][code][url=https://ko-fi.com/infarctus][img]https://github.com/doodlum/nexusmods-widgets/blob/main/Ko-fi_40px_60fps.png?raw=true[/img]

[size=4]Vortex Install (Easy)
[/size]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, locate WarHammer 40,000 Darktide in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it and install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]
[size=4]Vortex Install (Advanced)[/size]

[list]
[*]In Vortex, navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the Zip archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list][size=4]
Manual Install
[/size]
Extract the Zip archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\warhammer40kdarktide

[b][size=4]Important

[/size][/b][size=3]When you uninstall a mod on vortex, purge and redeploy mods to remove the folder especially if you use ﻿[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/warhammer40kdarktide/mods/139]Mod Load Order File Maker[/url]﻿.
If you don't use it you can use the load order tab to change the order or if a mod loads or not.[/size]

changelogs.text:
* **witcher3**: Allows more granular load order support (multiple entries per mod)
* **witcher3**: Fixes menu mod re-generation as part of collections
* **7daystodie**: Attempts to block UDF from being set to Vortex directories
* **stardewvalley**: Adds Settings option to backup mod config files. ([#15419](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/15419))

* Fixed exception when attempting to resolve the version of manually added mods without metadata
* Fixed crash when attempting to group by enabled state and mods are being actively removed. ([#16609](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16609))
* Fixed exception when attempting to see if the user is logged in. ([#16600](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16600))
* **api**: Updated libloot to 0.24.5
* **api**: Fixed several issues with version coercion in the bepinex extension. ([#16626](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16626))
* **witcher3**: Fixed minor issues caused by case sensitive checks

- Fixed failed profile switch when managing game using symlinks 
- Fixed download notification spamming the UI during collection install
- Fixes GameId/domainName reverse conversion not catering for multiple compatible games 
- Improved Vortex corruption error message. ([#16591](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16591))
- Fixes semantic coercion with leading zeroes
- Fixed semver bug when whitespace in mod versions
- Fixed promise chain when applying ini tweaks for Gamebryo games
- **7daystodie**: Fixed UDF dialog being raised incorrectly
- **collections**: Fixed collapsed mods tab table
- **bepinex**: Fixed installation error when installing BepInEx 6.0. ([#16587](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16587), [#15933](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/15933))
- **bepinex**: Fixed issues with BepInEx's mod entry update.

- Fixed incorrect fallback mod update selection
- Fixed updater ignoring pre-release tag
- Adding alternative game domains to future-proof API changes

- Fixed UpdateSet initializing for non-FBLO games. ([#16544](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16544), [#16545](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16545))
- Fixed checkboxes not rendering on load order entries.

It's beta time again as we have plenty of fixes and a few new things to show off. The main new feature being able to multi-select load order entries on games that utilize Vortex's file-based load ordering. These games include Baldur's Gate 3, Starfield and Witcher 3  

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b45efda-d983-42e4-9e94-0997218b4afa)

These games also benefit from the load order now being modifiable by changing the index of each entries

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0c27de42-3131-4ea5-afd6-7fb8188351cf)

A collections quality-of-life feature has been added so you can re-apply the rules defined in the collection's metadata. This can be accessed by right clicking a collection on the Mods page and choosing "Apply Collection Rules". This can be helpful if the collection rules weren't applied correctly in the first place or the user has made changes and want's to revert back.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4c968f7b-a841-4fbd-a46e-fbe77d8a3981)

### What's New ([full changelog](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md))

- Fixed exception when unmanaging (some) community game extensions. ([#16507](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16507), [#16372](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16372))
- Fixed attempts to import local downloads when no game is active. ([#16363](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16363))
- Improved checks for mod updates. ([#16453](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16453))
- Resolve mod installation profile query (if only 1 available). ([#16438](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16438))
- Added multi-select drag-and-drop to file-based load order.
- Added direct index typing to file-based load order.
- Added ability to modify the index of a load order entry using keyboard (click on index and modify it)
- Added ability to run up to 3 dependency installers in parallel
- Added FNV sanity checks extension as a requirement for Fallout New Vegas
- Removed redundant check when generating extended items.
- Fixed/Removed redundant deployment events during collection installation.
- Fixed inability to install non-extensions from site domain. ([#16481](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16481))
- Fixed file-based load order update set not initializing correctly.
- Fixed manual deployment actions not recognized correctly.
- Fixed manual file override assignment if/when mod has multiple matching file base names.
- Fixed FBLO spamming log information for games that do not use that component (e.g. Skyrim).
- Fixed redundant file override logic execution when nothing had changed.
- Fixed FOLON/FO4 mixed collection issue. ([#16305](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16305))
- Less generic error for rate limit breaches.
- Added ability to disable the experimental move deployment method through the game registration call. ([#16200](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16200))
- Fixed premature fileName reference comparison failure during collection install
- **api**: Added coreceVersion as an API utility function ([#16304](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16304))
- **api**: (Deprecated) libxmljs is no longer exported as part of Vortex's API.
- **api**: Fixed load order entries losing their index on mod update/re-install. ([#16086](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16086))
- **collections**: Fixed crash when switching profiles in the collection install dialog. ([#16242](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16242))
- **collections**: Now uses improved coercion to better support dependency detection
- **collections**: Added context menu action to apply collection rules manually
- **mod-dependency-manager**: No longer trim the versions of the mods to 3 digits
- **modtype-bepinex**: Improved error handling for when no matching bepinex pack is found. ([#15933](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/15933))
- **baldursgate3**: Fix to support Patch 7 load order format. ([#16384](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16384))
- **witcher3**: Fixed incorrect mod type assignment for certain mods
- **masterchiefcollection**: Reduced mod depth to better support the new mod type

- Fixed Starfield CC plugins being detected as native
- **baldursgate3**: Load order will now serialize to exactly match IGMM `modsettings.lsx` format.

- Fixed mod enable notification not appearing
- **7daystodie**: Fixed UDF error when directory contains whitespace. ([16445](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16445))
- **plugin-management**: Added Starfield: Shattered Space plugin to native list
- **plugin-management**: Added ability to resolve native plugins through Regex patterns.
**plugin-management:** Updated libloot to 0.23.1

- Fixed inability to update/download folon mods through collections. ([16267](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16267))
- Disallow error reports caused by faulty launchers in contributed extensions. ([16215](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16215), [16250](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16250))
- Fixed mods update error handling. ([16251](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16251))
- Fixed unsuccessful (statusCode != 200) request error handling.
- **masterchiefcollection**: New mod format support. ([13745](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/13745))

- Fixed crash when comparing objects with skippable properties. ([#16234](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16234))
- Fixed inability to update mods that are tagged as compatibleDownloads. ([#16231](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16231))
- Fixed downloads/installation stalling when Vortex is in background.
- **plugin-management**: Removed non-relevant loot messages from inlined view

- Fixed extension installation not executing from downloads page. ([#16197](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16197))
- Fixed inability to download from mega.nz as part of collection. ([#16176](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/16176))

1.11 is finally ready to go! This took a bit longer than expected due to the Fallout 4 Next-Gen release but this update intends to resolve a few long standing issues which have affected collection curators and game extensions that utilize Vortex's File-Based Load Ordering functionality.

For the collection curators - the comparison of  [patches](https://feedback.nexusmods.com/posts/1842/compare-replicate-and-binary-patch-options-when-installing-a-collection) and [installer choices](https://feedback.nexusmods.com/posts/1841/compare-fomod-options-when-installing-a-collection), modtype changes and bundled-mod file lists now takes place during collection installation. This means that Vortex will compare the options that the user selected for the currently installed mod against those packaged by the curator of the collection they are downloading. 

**Note for curators** - please make sure your mods are set to the correct mod type when generating/updating a collection as that is the mod type that will be pushed to your users regardless of the game extension configuration.

The File-Based Load Ordering more is performant in the core app with a lot of the feedback coming from the Baldur's Gate 3 community. We've had to wait to push the game extension update until the core was ready but we now have a more performant load ordering, PAK file reading, caching etc. Along with these changes, collection installations are now quicker because of it. Along with Baldur's Gate 3, other games that use this functionality include Starfield, Cyberpunk 2077 and several other community written extensions.

Our update workflow has been overhauled with rewritten notifications, added info dialogs when swapping update channels as well as turned off force download of updates (unless they are hotfixes and need to be pushed out for security\stability reasons).

If you discover any issues, please check the [Nexus Mods Forums](https://forums.nexusmods.com/forum/4306-vortex-support/) or in [Discord](https://discord.com/channels/215154001799413770/408252140533055499) and report bugs via [GitHub](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/new/choose). Thanks and happy modding!

### Full Changelog

- Fixed re-render issue when enabling/disabling mod entries in the file-based load order
- libloot updated to 0.22.4
- Add support for Fallout 4 on Epic ([#15580](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/15580))
- Add support for new BA2 archive headers in Gamebryo games 
- New update workflow to better communicate What's New, minimize auto downloading (unless critical hotfixes) and more information when swapping update channels. ([#15363](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/15363))
- **vortex-api**: Fixed performance degradation when downloading collections for games that use the file based load order system. ([#15395](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/15395))
- **stardewvalley**: Fixed SMAPI update notification appearing while managing other games
- **collections**: Added comparison of patches, installer choices, hashes when installing. ([#15396](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/15396))
- **collections**: Updated styles to fix update changelog bounds
- **collections**: Better logging when profile switching

Comparison of [patches](https://feedback.nexusmods.com/posts/1842/compare-replicate-and-binary-patch-options-when-installing-a-collection) and [installer choices](https://feedback.nexusmods.com/posts/1841/compare-fomod-options-when-installing-a-collection) now takes place during collection installation. Vortex now compares the options the user selected for the currently installed mod against those packaged by the curator of the collection they are downloading.

We've put in a lot of work to make the File-Based Load Ordering more performant in the core app with a lot of the feedback coming from the Baldur's Gate 3 community. We've had to wait to push the game extension update until the core was ready but we now have a more performant load ordering, PAK file reading, caching etc. Along with these changes, collection installations are now quicker because of it.

Our update workflow has been overhauled with rewritten notifications, added info dialogs when swapping update channels as well as turned off force download of updates (unless they are hotfixes and need to be pushed out for security\stability reasons). 

All of these changes have been tested in house for several weeks but still may not be perfect - it is a beta after all! As soon as these updates are confirmed to be stable then this update go out to everyone.

### Full Changelog

- New update workflow to better communicate What's New, minimize auto downloading (unless critical hotfixes) and more information when swapping update channels. Fixes [#15363](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/15363)
- (API) Fixed performance degradation when downloading collections for games that use the file based load order system. Fixes [#15395](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/15395)
- (Stardew) Fixed SMAPI update notification appearing while managing other games
- (Collections) Added comparison of patches, installer choices, hashes when installing. Fixes [#15396](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/15396)
- (Collections) Updated styles to fix update changelog bounds
- (Collections) Better logging when profile switching
- (Collections) Fixed rare crash where game version was being compared 
- (Collections) Improved error handling when displaying instructions. Fixes [#14570](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/14570)
- (Collections) Instructions textarea now fills available space. Fixes [#15394](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/15394)
- (Collections) Override overflow now scrolls vertically
- (BepInEx) Fixed download issues caused by package resolution applying the new archive format to 5.x.x versions of BepInEx
- (Dependency Management) Suppress error report when user cancels purge
- (Dependency Management) Fixed file overrides being cleared when switching to an empty profile 
- (Dependency Management) Fixed rare issue where it was possible for mods to fail deploying certain types 
- (Plugin Management) Fixed long delays when ascertaining if a plugin is marked light
- (Baldur's Gate 3) Performance improvements when installing collections and using LSLib
- (Baldur's Gate 3) Added caching to PAK reading
- (Baldur's Gate 3) Added a better .NET error catch and shows a fix dialog. Fixes [#15391](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/15391)
- (Announcements) Restyled announcement dashlet
- (Mod Management) Underscores in archive names no longer cause installation issues. Fixes [#15334](https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/issues/15334)
- (Theme) Fixed layout issues with Contrast and Compact theme
- (Theme) Added a Classic theme that uses the old colors
- Updated Log format
